summary: This bill, the Generating Retirement Ownership through Long-Term Holding Act, amends the Internal Revenue Code to allow individuals to defer recognition of capital gains taxes on reinvested capital gain dividends from regulated investment companies. It outlines specific rules for nonrecognition of gain, including when the gain is recognized (sale/redemption of shares or death), holding period rules, and exclusions for certain individuals and entities. Conforming amendments are made to related sections of the code, and the effective date is for taxable years ending after the bill's enactment.
